it.unifi.rc.httpserver.m5951907.handler

Class AbstractHTTPHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unifi.rc.httpserver.m5951907.handler.AbstractHTTPHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HTTPHandler, MyHTTPHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MyHTTPHandler1_0

    abstract class AbstractHTTPHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements MyHTTPHandler
    A class that factors away common characteristics of the various concrete implementations of HTTPHandler.
    Author:
    Simone Cipriani, 5951907

      • handle

        public HTTPReply handle(HTTPRequest request)
        Description copied from interface: HTTPHandler
        Handle a given HTTPRequest and, if this is the right handler, returns a HTTPReply. If this handler is not able to manage the request, value null is returned.
        Specified by:
        handle in interface HTTPHandler
        Parameters:
        request - a
        Returns:
        a HTTPReply that is null if this handler cannot manage the request.

      • handlingImplementation

        protected abstract HTTPReply handlingImplementation(HTTPRequest req)
                                             throws MyHTTPProtocolException
        This method should implement the methods defined in the proper HTTP protocol version.
        Parameters:
        req - an incoming HTTPRequest
        Returns:
        the proper HTTPReply
        Throws:
        MyHTTPProtocolException - if something is wrong

      • readResource

        java.lang.String readResource(java.lang.String url)
                       throws MyHTTPProtocolException
        Can be called by subclasses to fetch for a physical resource (I.E. a file).
        Parameters:
        url - of the requested resource
        Returns:
        a string container of the resource data
        Throws:
        MyHTTPProtocolException - when resource cannot be found

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the String with header fields and values
